content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at approximately (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Factory burner inserter (retrieved) at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
• Dedicated burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5)
• Assembling machine interfaced at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

This structure serves as the interface for copper-cable production, linking input storage with processing via inserters.

### Extraction Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
• Wooden chest (belt depot) placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
• Adjacent transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
• Dedicated depot burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5)

This depot is designed to receive items from the extraction system via multi‐segment transport belts.

### Extraction System at (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
• Extraction system burner inserter located at Position(x=–3.5, y=27.5) with drop position at Position(x=–3.5, y=28.5)

This element functions as the remote source for transferring resources into connected belt systems.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors (occurred in Steps 210, 211, 214, 215, 216, and 217)
 – When connecting transport belts, do not use a steam engine (Prototype.SteamEngine) as the target.
 – Instead, ensure that an inserter is placed to serve as the valid target for belt input.

• Placement Distance and Inventory Errors
 – If an entity (e.g. a wooden chest) fails to be placed due to excessive distance, move the player closer so that the target position is within the allowed range.
 – Before attempting to place an entity, verify that it exists in the inventory to avoid “No [entity] in inventory” errors.

• Name and Variable Definition Errors
 – Ensure every variable (for example, the intended target chest) is properly defined and consistently referenced to avoid NameError issues.
